Question 6 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MSQ (2M) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question ID : 823251570 
 
Define R
n
 to be the maximum amount earned by cutting a rod of length n meters into one or more pieces 
of integer length and selling them. For i > 0, let p [i] denote the selling price of a rod whose length is i 
meters. Consider the array of prices: 
 
 
 
p[l] = l,p[2] = 5, p[3] = 8,p[4] = 9. p[5] = 10, p[6] = I7,p[7] = 13 
 
Which of the following statements is/are correct about R
7 
?  
 
Options : 
 
(A) R
7 
cannot be achieved by a solution consisting of three picccs. 
 
(B) R
7 
is achieved by three different solutions. 
 
(C) R
7
 = 19 
 
(D) R
7 = 
18 
Ans. 
B, D
